ratings.question_text: I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: What is the name of your TA?
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: The quality of the experience depends to such a great degree on interaction with the client that it is hard to generalize about this course. With regards to my experience, though, I'd say that I learned a ton this semester, both substantively through the project research and procedurally about how to manage working with a team and a client.

A student's experience of this class is entirely dependent on his or her project. Fortunately, Maureen does a great job of assembling quality projects so that there are a lot of good options. She is also very upfront about each client's advantages and disadvantages, so students know what they are getting into. I was 100% happy with my project and my client, and I am very grateful to Maureen for making it all happen.

- The ability to work on a real-life problem for a client organization.- Client was engaged and responsive throughout the semester.- Prompt feedback from the instructor on all deliverables.- Great team dynamic on project.- Interesting guest speakers.
Access to an actual client. I felt that my work was actually a useful contributed to the world.
The opportunity to work on a real project and seek to influence the decision-making process of an important client.
Direct communication with the client.

Getting a chance to do a real-world project for a real-world client. Hopefully our product will help inform the company's decisions moving forward. It is great to be able to balance out the more academic FES coursework with this type of practical experience.
Potentially, the clients, if you get a decent client.
real-world problems.

Learning through real-world application of skills, including consistent support from Maureen along the way (regular meetings, feedback on written products). I also liked the guest talks, and being able to have a good Q&A with them as part of their presentations.
Getting to hear about the other projects was insightful.
The opportunity to apply and test ones's skills

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: - Stronger in-class curriculum outside of guest speakers.- The work content was much lighter than I would have imagined or liked. I wonder how much value we really added to the client organization with the high-level nature of the analysis. Other clinics are more rigorous and demand a far higher quality and quantity of output.

I thought the class sessions were not always that helpful. The session on presentation skills, for example, could have been dropped altogether, and there were others that didn't add a ton of value for me. The opportunities to hear from guest speakers and engage with them about their internal initiatives were much better.
Some of the powerpoint presentations in the beginning of the semester -- how to be a consultant, etc -- were rather weak and that time could probably be used in a more useful manner.

Everything. One of the worst courses I have ever taken. Both the course and professor are poorly organized.1. This is a course organized around group work, and the groups themselves were not well considered.2. The classes had little if anything to do with the work for the course. It was a clinic course and yet we had random lectures about renewable energy; the connection was tenuous at best.3. When giving a lecture using powerpoint about powerpoint presentations, it is useful to have a decent powerpoint presentation. Most students were in awe that anyone would pay the professor for said consulting services.4. The professor was not responsive to students comments/question and was in fact often defensive-- both in class and during our weekly group meetings with the professor.5. When it was all said and done, I got so very little out of this class. I had such high expectations, but as I said before this is easily the worst course I have ever take at FES.
not sure what you should change
This seems a bit nit-picky, but the slides are a bit old school and it can take a long time to find things when going back to them.
The client could have been engaged more. Possibly requiring the client to donate to a fund to be a part of the clinic might help.
A bit more depth on consulting skills and methodology

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: - Extremely responsive and useful feedback and support from the instructor.
Maureen provided an excellent amount of feedback. She provided a wealth of writing review comments and project suggestions.
Excellent support from the instructor. Great feedback and guidance.
Through the whole project from the very initial contact with the client to the final report.
Maureen is incredibly available and responsive. I have no idea how she is able to review our drafts so quickly!
great

Very high - Maureen is great about being available for meetings, quick to respond to emails, and flexible. She also asks good questions and has suggestions for alternative ways to present or think about issues.
We met weekly with the instructor and she was available via email.
The weekly meetings were tremendously helpful

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: Another great opportunity for real-world experiential learning, establishing networks and contacts in the sustainability space and learn from my teammates.
A great course for understanding how businesses think about environmental issues and make decisions with regards to new investment in more sustainable technologies or approaches.
Good.
This course helped give me direct experience in the corporate sustainability field so that I feel more prepared for my post-FES career.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: For the experiential learning opportunity and to build networks in the environment / sustainability space.
I wanted practice doing environmental consulting.
To have an opportunity to work as a consultant, to learn about the internal processes of a major corporate client, to make a difference on a high-level strategic project
To increase my practical experience on climate change.
interested in the client list
I like learning through practical application, and also think it's a really good way to add to my professional experience and network.
I wanted to get client experience.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Somewhat. While I'm still unsure of the real value of our work, it was still a great learning experience and networking opportunity.
Yes, but you generally get out what you put into this class.
Yes, I got a lot out of this course.
yes.
Yes, definitely.
No.
yes
Yes. We had a great client and team.
Yes.

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Somewhat. While I'm still unsure of the real value of our work, it was still a great learning experience and networking opportunity.
Yes, and more.
I learned more about managing people and processes than I expected, which was good.
Yes.
No.
yes
Yes.
At the beginning the client was involved. Toward the end, contact was sparse at best.
Yes.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Group work was invaluable in dividing and conquering project deliverables.Great team dynamic and good mix of skills and working styles made for a fairly easygoing but high-quality work environment.Different working styles sometimes caused progress to be slower than ideal, but issues always got worked out without compromising on quality or timeliness of output.
Small group size made it difficult, but quality of group members was good.

I learned a ton from my group and found it a useful challenge to deal with different work styles. There were numerous disagreements that slowed us down, which was difficult at times, but there was also good learning in that, as we figured out how to handle those differences.
Advantage: I have learned how to coordinate with team members.

I loved the group work. Working with a team is part of the working world, so in that way, the group aspect of this course is a valuable learning experience in addition to the actual projects we completed. It helps when you're very happy with the other members of your team, which I was.

The advantages were that some students were able to do little if any work and still get credit for the course since all work was group work. The disadvantage was that the remaining members had to carry the day.
advantage - different backgrounds, strengths and perspectivesdisadvantage - keeping people on task, coordinating schedules

We had a great team with complementary skills, styles, and approaches. It actually went so smoothly that the load didn't ever fall too heavily on any single person. Disadvantage was just the perennial issue that you don't always have fast enough or clear enough communication to know what everyone else is working on at any given time.
Scheduling meeting times was difficult.Learning from others experiences was interesting.

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: You get what you give in.
The unexpected will occur. Group work will make everything take longer. Set clear goals with your client, but be flexible.
Good choice if you want to have more experience working with a real-world client.
Avoid this course like the plague. It's never to late to drop.
Make sure to pay attention to how available the client will be, when applying to projects.
You get what you put into it. If the client is not responsive, you can still have a worthwhile experience if you explore avenues of interest to you.
